derivation: probably from the base of G3145 (μάστιξ) (through the idea of contact);
strongs_def: a whip (literally, the Roman flagellum for criminals; figuratively, a disease)
outline:
1. a whip, scourge
  2. metaph. a scourge, plague
    1. a calamity, misfortune, esp. sent by God to discipline or punish
